greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: T(n,k) an additive decomposition of the signed tangent number (triangle read by rows).
comment: The Swiss-Knife polynomials A153641 can be understood as a sum of polynomials. Evaluated at x=1 these polynomials result in a decomposition of the signed tangent numbers A009006.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for the first 50 rows
formula: Let c(k) = frac{(-1)^{floor(k/4)}{2^{floor(k/2)}} [4 not div k] (Iverson notation).
maple: T := proc(n,k) local v,c; c := m -> if irem(m+1,4) = 0 then 0 else 1/((-1)^iquo(m+1,4)*2^iquo(m,2)) fi; add((-1)^(v)*binomial(k,v)*c(k)*(v+2)^n,v=0..k) end: seq(print(seq(T(n,k),k=0..n)),n=0..8);
mathematica: c[m_] := If[Mod[m+1, 4] == 0, 0, 1/((-1)^Quotient[m+1, 4]*2^Quotient[m, 2])]; t[n_, k_] := Sum[(-1)^v*Binomial[k, v]*c[k]*(v+2)^n, {v, 0, k}]; Table[t[n, k], {n, 0, 7}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jul 30 2013, after Maple *)
results.author: _Peter Luschny_, Jan 07 2009
